review: For price and ease of use, I definitely whole-heartedly recommend the Fire TV Stick!I bought Chromecast for my Dad and the Fire Stick for me, and the Fire Stick is definitely the winner in my book. Had it been available when I bought the Chromecast, the Chromecast definitely would have gone back. They offer very similar things, and maybe an advanced user would have more fun with the Chromecast. But when you're trying to help a 64-year-old man use Netflix and HBO Go, the fewer the devices, the better. Showing him how to download the software on his phone and sync it to the TV was way more work than just pointing the Fire Stick's remote at the TV and using menus that look just like cable menus. And now I've downloaded the Fire remote app, so I don't have to go digging through the couch cushions every time the actual remote disappears.Occasionally I have an issue when I've left it on screensaver mode too long: the audio works but the screen is black. Simply unplugging the device and plugging it back in seems to solve the issue. I'll update if it gets any buggier, but I don't anticipate any problems.
